Description for PHIL 490W, Senior Seminar
Freedom and Determinism in the age of Neuroscience. This senior seminar will investigate contemporary arguments about free will as shaped by developments in neuroscience. We will review canonical arguments for and against the possibility of agency and follow by investigating the ways in which "the era of the brain" has shaped our beliefs about the possibility of free will and moral responsibility. In doing so, we will consider how neuroscientific information (particularly evidence from fMRI studies) has influenced discussions about the possibility of legal responsibility.
course_description: Study of the nature of philosophy, relationships among the various fields of philosophy, and connections among various fundamental problems in philosophy, approached from the perspective of each student's own course of undergraduate study in philosophy. Required of all philosophy majors.
prerequisites: Two PHIL courses or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
